channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Fallen tree in the brook, 21st November
item.description:
A tree has fallen in the brook, which may cause a build up of debris and consequently a flood risk as the movement of water is blocked.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Clyde Road, Brockworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Filter light not working, 21st November
item.description:
After repairing manhole yesterday, the filter light hasnâ€™t been turned back on causing lengthy queues. Lights are also not on long enough to let a reasonable amount of traffic through causing traffic to back up onto Elmbridge court roundabout at peak times which is dangerous. Also, please can highways clear away all their signs, barriers and sandbags which have been abandoned all over the pavements in the area now works have been completed on those parts of the roads.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cheltenham Road East, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Green or amber traffic light is not working

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 94, Parton Road, Churchdown, Tewkesbury

item.title: Very large and UNEXPECTED dip in the road, 21st November
item.description:
I have listed this as a pothole as there are no options for this problem.If you are travelling along Up Hatherley Way,Cheltenham towards Morrisons from the little roundabout at the end of Grovefield way there is a large UNEXPECTED dip in the road which takes motorists by surprise as it is mainly concealed.This is very dangerous for cyclists especially.If nothing is done the n the dip will undoubtedly turn into a large pothole AREA.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cold Pool Lane, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: R/H side of speed hump has pot hole on uphill side, 20th November
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 108, Albert Road, Marle Hill, Cheltenham

item.title: The button is stuck and is stopping the traffic every 15 seconds, pedestrians are also taking chances as some cars are ignoring the signal, 20th November
item.description:
80 priors road, crossing operated by button is stuck, this is a very busy crossing and pedestrians are now starting to take chance as the lights are stopping traffic every 15 seconds, some cars have started to ignore the lights and go through the reds putting them in danger
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 80, Priors Road, Lynworth, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dumped chest of drawers, 20th November
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 76, Reddings Road, Hatherley, Cheltenham

item.title: Mud and debris on pavement from nearby construction site, 20th November
item.description:
The pavement from kidnappers lane down to Farmfield road is covered in mud and debris. This is on left hand side going towards Shurdington. There are large clumps of mud that fall off lorries plus the spray from road cleaning vehicle. It is very slippery when wet and very messy to walk through.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Shurdington Road, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
